message_1: Find the number of triangles in a complete graph K<sub>7</sub>.
message_2:
A complete graph K<sub>n</sub> is a graph with n vertices, where each vertex is connected to every other vertex. In a complete graph K<sub>7</sub>, there are 7 vertices.

To form a triangle in a complete graph, we need to choose 3 vertices out of the 7 available vertices. The number of ways to do this is given by the combination formula:

C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

In our case, n = 7 (number of vertices) and k = 3 (number of vertices needed to form a triangle).

C(7, 3) = 7! / (3!(7-3)!)
= 7! / (3!4!)
= (7 × 6 × 5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1) / ((3 × 2 × 1)(4 × 3 × 2 × 1))
= (7 × 6 × 5) / (3 × 2 × 1)
= 35

So, there are 35 triangles in a complete graph K<sub>7</sub>.
